author: paperliss
content:
I'm not sure what kind of a response I'm hoping to get from this, but I figured someone in this chat would likely have some helpful advice. I'm very interested in blockchain technology and would like to have a career in it. However, I find there is quite a lot of things to know in this space, and I sometimes find it hard to know where I should be focusing my energy or even what my end goal should be (front end dev, solidity dev, something else).

My current skills/ Knowledge (Intermediate understanding):
    Javascript
    Python 
    C++
    Complexity Analisys 
    Data Structers
    Algorithems
    Consepts related to blockchain:
        Hashing Algorithems
        Private key / Public key cryptography (surface level)
        Consensus (PoW, PoS)
        Governance (Hard forks vs Soft foks vs On-Chain)
        Smart Contracts (Solidity)
        Terminology (Blocks, Transactions, Roll-ups, 
Composability, etc.)

Things I'm interested in learning:
    Rust
    Web Assembly 
    Machine Learning 
    ZKproofs
    React
    More about:
        Eth2 Consensus
        Smart Contract development
        Web3
        EVM / Ewasm

About me:
I was enrolled in university studying computer science until (among other reasons) I realized how old the curriculum I was learning was, so, at the start of the pandemic, I decided to advance my education through online educational resources instead. I had become very interested in the space (Ethereum in particular) starting in 2017. I have recently been reading articles, GitHub conversations, and listings to core dev meetings on youtube to understand everything that's going on.

Any advice / Educational resources would be appreciated!
